sen.j: 緒方 洪庵（おがた こうあん、文化 (元号)7年7月14日 (旧暦)（1810年8月13日） - 文久3年6月10日 (旧暦)（1863年7月25日））は日本の武士・足守藩士、医師、蘭学者である。
sen.e: Koan OGATA (August 13, 1810 - July 25, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, a feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain, a doctor and a Dutch scholar.
Koan OGATA (August 13, 1810 - July 25, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain, doctor, and Dutch scholar.
sen.cmt: 「足守藩士」以降に付けられている不定冠詞を削除しました。
sen.e: Koan OGATA (August 13, 1810 - July 25, 1863) was a Japanese samurai, feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain, doctor, and Dutch scholar.

sen.j: 大坂に適塾を開き、人材を育てた。
sen.e: He opened Tekijyuku (a private school) in Osaka to educate people.
He opened a private school named Tekijuku in Osaka to educate people.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: He opened a private school named Tekijuku in Osaka to educate people.

sen.j: 諱は章、字は公裁、号を洪庵の他に適々斎・華陰と称する。
sen.e: Koan's imina (personal name) was Akira, his azana (adult male's nickname)was Kosai, and his go (pen name) were Tekitekisai and 華陰 besides Koan.
Koan's imina (personal name) was Akira, his azana (adult male's nickname)was Kosai, and his go (pen name) were Tekitekisai and 華陰 besides Koan.
Koan's imina (personal name) was Akira, his azana (adult male's nickname)was Kosai, and his go (pen name) were Tekitekisai and 華陰 besides Koan.

tit.e: Brief Chronological List of Main Events
Brief Chronological List of Main Events
Brief Chronological List of Main Events

sen.j: 備中国足守藩士・佐伯瀬左衛門の三男として足守（現・岡山県岡山市北区 (岡山市)足守）に生まれる。
sen.e: Koan was born the third son to Saemon SAEKI, a feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain of Bicchu Province, in Ashimori (present-day, Ashimori, Kita Ward, Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture).
Born the third son to Sezaemon SAEKI, a feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain of Bicchu Province, in Ashimori (present-day, Ashimori, Kita Ward, Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ・「瀬左衛門」は「せざえもん」と思われます。・下に「この頃から緒方洪庵と名乗った模様」とあるので、それまでは「洪庵」を使用しないほうがいいと判断し、かつ年譜風に記載することとしました。
sen.e: Born the third son to Sezaemon SAEKI, a feudal retainer of the Ashimori Domain of Bicchu Province, in Ashimori (present-day, Ashimori, Kita Ward, Okayama City, Okayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 文政8年（1825年） 大坂蔵屋敷留守居となった父と共に大坂に出る。
sen.e: In 1825: Koan moved to Osaka with his father when his father was appointed as a rusui (caretaker) of Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) of Osaka.
1825: Moved to Osaka with his father when he was appointed as a rusui (caretaker) of the Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) in Osaka.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: 1825: Moved to Osaka with his father when he was appointed as a rusui (caretaker) of the Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) in Osaka.

sen.j: 文政9年（1826年） 中天游の私塾「思々斎塾」にて4年間、蘭学を学ぶ。
sen.e: In 1826: Koan learned Western studies at 'Shishisaijuku', a private school established by Naka Tenyu (Western medicine doctor), for four years.
1826: Learned Western studies at 'Shishisaijuku', a private school established by Tenyu NAKA, a Western medicine doctor, for four years.
sen.cmt: 人物名の表記方法の修正
sen.e: 1826: Learned Western studies at 'Shishisaijuku', a private school established by Tenyu NAKA, a Western medicine doctor, for four years.

sen.j: 天保2年（1831年） 江戸へ出て坪井信道に学び、さらに宇田川玄真にも学んだ。
sen.e: In 1831: Koan went to Edo to learn under Shindo TSUBOI and also Genshin UDAGAWA (both Western medicine doctors).
1831: Went to Edo to study under Shindo TSUBOI and also Genshin UDAGAWA, both of whom were Western medicine doctors.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: 1831: Went to Edo to study under Shindo TSUBOI and also Genshin UDAGAWA, both of whom were Western medicine doctors.

sen.j: 天保7年（1836年） 長崎市へ遊学しオランダ人医師・ニーマンのもとで医学を学ぶ。
sen.e: In 1836: Genpo visited Nagasaki City to learn practical medical science under a Dutch doctor, Niemann.
sen.cmt: ニーマン：スペルが不明です。
sen.e: 1836: Visited Nagasaki City to study medical science under Niemann, a Dutch doctor.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正･ニーマンの表記は合っていると思います。例えば、http://kotobank.jp/
sen.e: 1836: Visited Nagasaki City to study medical science under Niemann, a Dutch doctor.

sen.j: この頃から緒方洪庵と名乗った模様。
sen.e: It is considered that Genpo started calling himself as Koan OGATA around this period.
It appears that he started to call himself Koan OGATA around this period.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: It appears that he started to call himself Koan OGATA around this period.

sen.j: 天保9年（1838年）春 大坂に帰り、瓦町（現・大阪市中央区 (大阪市)瓦町）で医業を開業する。
sen.e: In Spring 1838: Koan returned to Osaka to begin practice as a doctor in Kawara-cho (present-day, Kawara Town, Chuo Ward, Osaka City).
Spring 1838: Returned to Osaka to work as a doctor in Kawaramachi (present-day, Kawaramachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City).
sen.cmt: 昔の「瓦町」が今のそれと同じ読み方をするのかは不明です。今の読み方に合わせました。
sen.e: Spring 1838: Returned to Osaka to work as a doctor in Kawaramachi (present-day, Kawaramachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City).

sen.j: 同時に蘭学塾「適々斎塾（適塾）」を開く。
sen.e: At the same time, he established a private school for Western studies, 'Tekitekisai juku (Tekijuku)'.
At the same time, he established a private school for Western studies, 'Tekitekisai juku (Tekijuku)'.
At the same time, he established a private school for Western studies, 'Tekitekisai juku (Tekijuku)'.

sen.j: 同年、天游門下の先輩・億川百記の娘・八重と結婚。
sen.e: In the same year, Koan got married to Yae, a daughter of Hyakki OKUGAWA, Koan's senior of Tenyu's school.
In the same year, Koan got married to Yae, a daughter of Hyakki OKUGAWA, Koan's classmate of Tenyu's school.
sen.cmt: ・「億川」を「おくかわ」とするサイトもあります。・「先輩」は英語圏にはないものなので、クラスメイトとしました。
sen.e: In the same year, Koan got married to Yae, a daughter of Hyakki OKUGAWA, Koan's classmate of Tenyu's school.

sen.j: のち6男7女をもうける。
sen.e: He later became a father of six sons and seven daughters.
He later became a father of six sons and seven daughters.
He later became a father of six sons and seven daughters.

sen.j: 弘化2年（1845年） 過書町（現・大阪市中央区淀屋橋）の商家を購入し適塾を移転。
sen.e: In 1845: Koan bought a mercantile house in Kashomachi (present-day, Yodoyabashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) to relocate his Tekijuku.
1845: Bought a mercantile house in Kashomachi (present-day, Yodoyabashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) to relocate his Tekijuku.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: 1845: Bought a mercantile house in Kashomachi (present-day, Yodoyabashi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) to relocate his Tekijuku.

sen.j: 移転の理由は洪庵の名声がすこぶる高くなり、門下生も日々増え瓦町の塾では手狭となった為である。
sen.e: This relocation was unavoidable because Koan's fame brought so many people to the school that the place in Kawaramachi became too small to accommodate all of them.
This relocation was unavoidable because Koan's fame brought so many people to the school that the place in Kawaramachi became too small to accommodate all of them.
This relocation was unavoidable because Koan's fame brought so many people to the school that the place in Kawaramachi became too small to accommodate all of them.

sen.j: 嘉永2年11月7日 (旧暦)（1849年12月21日） その6日前に京に赴き種痘を得、古手町（現・大阪市中央区道修町）に「除痘館」を開き、牛痘種痘法による切痘を始める。
sen.e: December 21, 1849: six days prior to the date, Koan visited the capital to obtain smallpox vaccine which was made from cow's smallpox pus, and started vaccinating people at 'Joto-kan' (literally, vaccination house) he opened in Kote-cho (present-day, Doshu Town, Chuo Ward, Osaka City).

December 21, 1849: Started vaccinating people at 'Joto-kan' (literally, vaccination house) he opened in Furutemachi (present-day, Doshomachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) by using smallpox vaccine obtained in the capital six days earlier.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・地名の読み方の修正をしました。
sen.e: December 21, 1849: Started vaccinating people at 'Joto-kan' (literally, vaccination house) he opened in Furutemachi (present-day, Doshomachi, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) by using smallpox vaccine obtained in the capital six days earlier.

sen.j: 嘉永3年（1850年） 郷里の足守藩より要請があり「足守除痘館」を開き切痘を施した。
sen.e: In 1850: Koan opened another smallpox-vaccination center, 'Ashimori Joto-kan', in response to a request from the Ashimori Domain.
1850: Opened another smallpox-vaccination center, 'Ashimori Joto-kan', in response to a request from the Ashimori Domain.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: 1850: Opened another smallpox-vaccination center, 'Ashimori Joto-kan', in response to a request from the Ashimori Domain.

sen.j: 安政5年4月24日 (旧暦)（1858年6月5日） 洪庵の天然痘予防の活動を幕府が公認する。
sen.e: June 5, 1858: Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) authorized the smallpox-vaccination activity of Koan.
1858: Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) authorized Koan's smallpox-vaccination activity.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: 1858: Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) authorized Koan's smallpox-vaccination activity.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年） 徳川幕府の度重なる要請により奥医師兼西洋医学所頭取として、江戸に出仕する。
sen.e: In 1862: After repeated requests from the Tokugawa Shogunate, Koan decided to attend at the court in Edo both as an inner doctor who treated the TOKUGAWA family and the head of the School of Western Medical Science.
1862: Moved to Edo to serve as an inner doctor assigned to the Tokugawa family and head of the School of Western Medical Science in response to the Tokugawa Shogunate's repeated requests.
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正をしました。・TOKUGAWA family としていますが、個人名ではないので、Tokugawa としました。
sen.e: 1862: Moved to Edo to serve as an inner doctor assigned to the Tokugawa family and head of the School of Western Medical Science in response to the Tokugawa Shogunate's repeated requests.

sen.j: 歩兵屯所付医師を選出するよう指示を受け、手塚良仙ら7名を推薦した。
sen.e: He was ordered to select doctors for foot-soldier quarters and recommended seven physicians including Ryosen TEZUKA.
He was ordered to select the doctors for foot-soldier quarters and recommended seven physicians including Ryosen TEZUKA.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: He was ordered to select the doctors for foot-soldier quarters and recommended seven physicians including Ryosen TEZUKA.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年6月10日）江戸の医学所頭取役宅で突然喀血し窒息により死去。
sen.e: June 10, 1863: Koan suddenly coughed up blood and choked to death at his own official residence of the Medical School in Edo.
June 10, 1863: Suddenly coughed up blood and choked to death at the official residence of the head of the School of Western Medical Science in Edo.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: June 10, 1863: Suddenly coughed up blood and choked to death at the official residence of the head of the School of Western Medical Science in Edo.

sen.j: 享年54（数え年）。
sen.e: His age of death was 54 (age by the traditional Japanese system).
His age of death was 54 (age by the traditional Japanese system).
His age of death was 54 (age by the traditional Japanese system).

sen.j: 洪庵の功績として、適塾から福澤諭吉、大鳥圭介、橋本左内、大村益次郎、長与専斎、佐野常民、高松凌雲など幕末から明治維新にかけて活躍した多くの人材を輩出した。
sen.e: The greatest achievement of Koan was to establish a private school, 'Tekijuku', where a numerous talented students were produced and they became well known from the end of the Edo Period through Meiji Restoration, including Yukichi FUKUZAWA, Keisuke OTORI, Sanai HASHIMOTO, Masujiro OMURA, Sensai NAGAYO, Tsunetami SANO and Ryoun TAKAMATSU.

Koan is credited with the establishment of a private school, Tekijuku, and many Tekijuku graduates including Yukichi FUKUZAWA, Keisuke OTORI, Sanai HASHIMOTO, Masujiro OMURA, Sensai NAGAYO, Tsunetami SANO, Ryoun TAKAMATSU took the lead in building a new society from the end of the Edo Period through the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Koan is credited with the establishment of a private school, Tekijuku, and many Tekijuku graduates including Yukichi FUKUZAWA, Keisuke OTORI, Sanai HASHIMOTO, Masujiro OMURA, Sensai NAGAYO, Tsunetami SANO, Ryoun TAKAMATSU took the lead in building a new society from the end of the Edo Period through the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: また、日本最初の病理学書『病学通論』を著した。
sen.e: Also, Koan wrote the first Japanese book on pathology called, "Byogaku Tsuron".
Also, Koan wrote Japan's first pathological book called "Byogaku Tsuron."
sen.cmt: 翻訳では「最初の日本語文献」となっており、原文の意とは異なるので修正しました。
sen.e: Also, Koan wrote Japan's first pathological book called "Byogaku Tsuron."

sen.j: 種痘を広め、自らも幼少の頃に患った天然痘の予防に尽力。
sen.e: He was committed to the prevention of the smallpox disease, which he also suffered from in his childhood, by popularizing vaccination in various parts of Japan.
He was committed to the prevention of smallpox, which he also suffered from in his childhood, by popularizing vaccination in various parts of Japan.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: He was committed to the prevention of smallpox, which he also suffered from in his childhood, by popularizing vaccination in various parts of Japan.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）のコレラ流行に際しては『虎狼痢治準』と題した治療手引き書を出版し医師に配布するなど日本医学の近代化に努めた。
sen.e: In 1858, when cholera epidemic broke out, Koan published and distributed to doctors a treatment guideline, "Korori Chijun", which greatly contributed to modernizing Japanese medical science.

As represented by his publication and distribution to doctors of a treatment guideline, "Korori Chijun" in response to a cholera epidemic in 1858, Koan contributed to the modernization of Japanese medical science.
sen.cmt: 翻訳では「虎狼痢治準が日本医学の近代化に努めた」となっており(文法上）、原文の意とは異なるので修正しました。
sen.e: As represented by his publication and distribution to doctors of a treatment guideline, "Korori Chijun" in response to a cholera epidemic in 1858, Koan contributed to the modernization of Japanese medical science.

sen.j: なお、自身も文化14年（1817年。8歳）のときに天然痘にかかっている。
sen.e: He suffered from smallpox himself in 1817 at the age of eight.
He suffered from smallpox himself in 1817 at the age of eight.
He suffered from smallpox himself in 1817 at the age of eight.

sen.j: 洪庵の人柄は温厚でおよそ人を怒ったことが無かったという。
sen.e: It is said that Koan was good-natured and almost never got angry at people.
It is said that Koan, good-natured, almost never got angry at people.
sen.cmt: 表現の簡略化をしました。
sen.e: It is said that Koan, good-natured, almost never got angry at people.

sen.j: また、洪庵には次のようなエピソードがある。
sen.e: Also, there is another episode about Koan.
Also, there is the following episode about Koan.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Also, there is the following episode about Koan.

sen.j: 福澤諭吉が適塾に入塾していた時に腸チフスを患った。
sen.e: Yukichi FUKUZAWA suffered from typhoid fever when he was a student of Tekijuku.
Yukichi FUKUZAWA suffered from typhoid fever when he was a student of Tekijuku.
Yukichi FUKUZAWA suffered from typhoid fever when he was a student of Tekijuku.

sen.j: 中津藩大坂蔵屋敷で療養していた折に洪庵が彼を手厚く看病し治癒した。
sen.e: When Yukichi was under treatment at Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) of Osaka, the Nakatsu Domain, Koan visited and nursed him intensively back to health.
When Yukichi was under treatment at the Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) of the Nakatsu Domain in Osaka, Koan nursed him devotedly back to health.
sen.cmt: 「中津藩大坂蔵屋敷」は大坂にある中津藩所有の蔵屋敷の意と思われるので、そのように修正しました。
sen.e: When Yukichi was under treatment at the Kurayashiki (Warehouse-residence) of the Nakatsu Domain in Osaka, Koan nursed him devotedly back to health.

sen.j: 諭吉はこれを終生忘れなかったそうである。
sen.e: It is said Yukichi never forgot the great effort Koan made for him.
It is said Yukichi never forgot Koan's dedication.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: It is said Yukichi never forgot Koan's dedication.

sen.j: このように他人を思いやり、面倒見の良い一面もあった。
sen.e: This episode tells that Koan was very considerate and caring.
This episode tells that Koan was very considerate and caring.
This episode tells that Koan was very considerate and caring.

sen.j: 洪庵は西洋医学を極めようとする医師としては珍しく漢方医学にも力を注いだ。
sen.e: Koan was also dedicated to learning Chinese medicine, which was unusual for someone who tried to master Western medicine.
Koan was also dedicated to learning Chinese medicine, which act was unusual for someone who tried to master Western medicine.
sen.cmt: 表現をより明確にしました。
sen.e: Koan was also dedicated to learning Chinese medicine, which act was unusual for someone who tried to master Western medicine.

sen.j: これは患者一人一人にとって最良の処方を常に考えていたためである。
sen.e: It is because Koan always wanted to find treatment best suited for each patient.
This is because Koan always tried to find treatment best suited for each patient.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: This is because Koan always tried to find treatment best suited for each patient.

tit.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。

sen.j: 緒方洪庵の孫の緒方知三郎は病理学者である。
sen.e: The grandson of Koan OGAWA, Tomozaburo OGATA, was a pathologist.
Tomozaburo OGATA, Koan's grandson, was a pathologist.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Tomozaburo OGATA, Koan's grandson, was a pathologist.

sen.j: 曾孫の緒方富雄は東京大学で血清学の研究を行い、日本の血清学の基礎を固めた。
sen.e: Koan's great-grandchild, Tomio OGATA, studied serology at the University of Tokyo and solidified the foundation of Japanese serology.
Koan's great-grandson, Tomio OGATA, studied serology at the University of Tokyo and solidified the foundation of serology in Japan.
sen.cmt: 男の曾孫であることを明確にしました。
sen.e: Koan's great-grandson, Tomio OGATA, studied serology at the University of Tokyo and solidified the foundation of serology in Japan.

sen.j: 昭和23年（1948年）3月に財団法人血清学振興会を設立し、血清学領域の基礎研究及び応用研究が行われてきた。
sen.e: In March 1948, Tomio established a foundation called, 'Society for Promotion of Serology', where various basic and applied researches on serology were conducted.
sen.cmt: 財団法人血清学振興会：正式英語名はわかりません。
sen.e: In March 1948, Tomio established a foundation called, 'Society for Promotion of Serology', where various basic and applied researches on serology were conducted.
In March 1948, Tomio established a foundation called, 'Society for Promotion of Serology', where various basic and applied researches on serology were conducted.

sen.j: その後緒方医学化学研究所に発展し、血清学に留まらず広く医学・歯学分野などの調査研究（学術誌：医学と生物学）を行っている。
sen.e: The foundation was later developed into 'Ogata Institute for Medical and Chemical Research' and widened its investigative research areas from serology to medical science and dentistry areas (ref. academic journal; medical science and biology).
sen.cmt: 医学と生物学：正式英語名はわかりません。
sen.e: The foundation was later renamed Ogata Institute for Medical and Chemical Research and has widened its investigative research areas from serology to medical science and dentistry (issuing an academic journal called Medical and Biology).
sen.cmt: ・表現の修正・「医学と生物学」はウィキペディアの「緒方・・・研究所」を参照しました。
sen.e: The foundation was later renamed Ogata Institute for Medical and Chemical Research and has widened its investigative research areas from serology to medical science and dentistry (issuing an academic journal called Medical and Biology).

sen.j: また、同研究所では緒方洪庵や杉田玄白、石川大浪、小石元瑞などの貴重な蘭学資料を「蘭学文庫」として所有し公開している。
sen.e: Also, the Institute posses and exhibits the so-called 'Western-study Library' consisting of valuable Western-study materials of Koan OGATA, Genpaku SUGITA, Tairo ISHIKAWA and Genzui KOISHI.

Also, the Institute possesses and exhibits the so-called 'Western studies Library' including valuable Western studies materials possessed by Koan OGATA, Genpaku SUGITA, Tairo ISHIKAWA and Genzui KOISHI.
sen.cmt: 表現の修正をしました。
sen.e: Also, the Institute possesses and exhibits the so-called 'Western studies Library' including valuable Western studies materials possessed by Koan OGATA, Genpaku SUGITA, Tairo ISHIKAWA and Genzui KOISHI.
